1.title: Google X Roboticist Speaks Out on Tech's Gender Crisis

episode of.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (TV Mini-Series 2015– )

1.plot: In the first episode of Re/code's new video series, "The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis," Leila Takayama of Google X discusses her early days at robotics pioneer Willow Garage, the importance of diverse perspectives in product design and how she has tackled subtle or explicit gender discrimination in her career.

2.title: Periscope Engineer: Tech's Gender Gap Is Tech's Fault

episode of.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (TV Mini-Series 2015– )

2.plot: For the second episode of "The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis," Re/code invited computer science student Ilona Bodnar to meet Periscope engineer Sara Haider. The promising student and rising industry leader discussed the challenges that women face in the industry and how to persevere in spite of them.

3.title: The 26%: Leading Roboticist Highlights Glass Ceilings, Blatant Misogyny in Tech

episode of.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (TV Mini-Series 2015– )

3.plot: In the latest episode of "The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis," Re/code sat down with Fetch Robotics CEO Melonee Wise to discuss the challenges facing women in tech.

4.title: Detroit Water Project Co-Founder on the Challenges Black Women Face in Tech

episode of.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (TV Mini-Series 2015– )

4.plot: In the latest episode of "The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis," Detroit Water Project Executive Director Tiffani Ashley Bell and Scripps College student Nma Mbeledogu discuss the challenges that black women face in the tech industry.

5.title: The 26%: Facebook's Mary Lou Jepsen Says Tech Is Hostitle to Women

episode of.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (TV Mini-Series 2015– )

5.plot: In the fifth and final episode of "The 26%: Women Speak Out On Tech's Diversity Crisis," Facebook's Mary Lou Jepsen discusses what it's like to be an executive woman in tech, how to persevere when you hear the word "impossible" and what companies can do to achieve their diversity goals.

imdb.title: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis
akas: The 26%: Women Speak Out on Tech's Diversity Crisis (United States)
